frameDefinitions: A Performer has a certain Role in a Performance and plays their part by following the directions in the Script for that particular Role.
An event or state (here termed an Eventuality) or time-Period is described in terms of the Degree to which its duration diverges from a standard.

This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.

A Factor affects the outcome of an Undertaking, which  can be a goal-oriented activity or the maintenance of a desirable state, the work in a Field, or something portrayed as affecting an Interested_party.
This frame contains words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their participation in artistic performances.
frameExamples: Margaret Thatcher <t>played</t> Juliet in a school play.
After a <t>lengthy</t> discussion with the Foreign Minister, Mr. Qian Qichen, they met the Prime Minister.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
Temperature is the most <t>critical</t> factor in successful storage.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Audience</fen> experiences the <fen>Performance</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Performer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Performance</fen> to the <fen>Audience</fen>.
The <fen>Performer</fen>s generates the <fen>Performance</fen> which  the <fen>Audience</fen> perceives.
The <fen>Performer</fen> provides an experience for the <fen>Audience</fen>.
The music which may be performed in the <fen>Performance</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.

The (usually written) directions which instruct the <fen>Performer</fen>s on what actions to perform, when, and how.  It has many different names depending on the <fen>Type</fen> of <fen>Performance</fen> including <ment>script</ment>, <ment>screenplay</ment>, <ment>libretto</ment>, <ment>book</ment>, and <ment>choreography</ment>.
This role indicates the subtype of <fen>Performance</fen>, including <ment>dance</ment>, <ment>theater</ment>, <ment>film</ment>, etc.

<fen>Role</fen> identifies one of the possible relations that the <fen>Performer</fen> can have to the <fen>Performance</fen>.  The <fen>Role</fen> (s) a <fen>Performer</fen> has in the <fen>Performance</fen> will determine which parts of the <fen>Script</fen> should be performed by the <fen>Performer</fen>, as the <fen>Script</fen> is written in terms of which <fen>Role</fen> (s) each set of instructions applies to.  In the fields of theater, movies, ballet, and opera, a <fen>Role</fen> generally corresponds to a character in the story of the <fen>Script</fen>, while other types of performance may use more general <fen>Role</fen>s like <ment>lead violinist</ment>.
The person that performs alongside Performer2.
The person that is also in the Performance, alongside Performer1.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> an event occurs.

A situation, action or event whose duration is being described.  The Eventuality occurs as the External Argument if the adjective is used predicatively, or as the modified noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Eventuality'>The lecture</fex> was <t>short</t>. We had a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Eventuality'>conversation</fex>.

Sometimes these adjectives describe simply a period of time, rather than an event or state.  The Period almost invariably occurs as the modified noun with an attributive adjective: We waited for only a <t>short</t> <fex name='Period'>time</fex>. Use of the drug over a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Period'>period</fex> can cause memory loss.

The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
<fen>Factor</fen> is used for the concrete or abstract entity whose importance is assessed.
The <fen>Undertaking</fen> is a process or state or field of activity in which the <fen>Interested_party</fen> has a stake.
<fen>Interested_party</fen> identifies the people who are affected by a particular <fen>Factor</fen>.
A <fen>Factor</fen> may be generally important to the people or the activities in a field of endeavour.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important to the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Factor</fen> is important.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the human being.
listRoleExamples: He co-starred <fex>with Matt Perry</fex> in Tool 3.
Who co-starred <fex>with Glen Close</fex> in that space opera thingy?
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
<fex>Being sure they are buying fresh food</fex> is important to most people.
Temperature is the most critical factor <fex>in successful storage</fex>.
Being sure they are buying fresh food is important <fex>to most people</fex>.
A successful GATT round is important <fex>for the world economy</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church
the Abbey Church of the Immaculate Conception Benedictine Abbey
The Society's Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church
the Society of Saint Pius X's Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church
"The Mother of God Enthroned in Glory"
The Daily Missal of the Mystical Body
"The Vision of King David and the Prophet Isaias"
The Art of the Beuron School
the Benedictine Order in the Abbey of Beuron
